FIFOCache

Type: Concrete Class

Description

FIFOCache<K, V> which extends AbstractCache is a simple in-memory cache that follows the First-In-First-Out eviction strategy. It maintains insertion order using a LinkedHashMap and automatically evicts the oldest entry once capacity is exceeded.

Use Cases

  • Simple bounded in-memory cache
  • Page cache or connection pool eviction
  • Testing and educational purposes for understanding FIFO strategy

Method Summary

Return Type Method Description Time Complexity
V get(K key) Returns the value associated with the given key, or null if not present. O(1)
void put(K key, V value) Inserts or updates an entry and evicts the oldest if capacity is reached. O(1)
int size() Returns the current number of entries in the cache. O(1)
void clear() Removes all entries from the cache. O(n)
boolean contains(K key) Checks whether the cache contains the given key. O(1)

Algorithm Details

The FIFOCache class implements a basic First-In-First-Out (FIFO) eviction policy:

  • Insertion: Adds a new key-value pair. If the key exists, updates the value. If the cache exceeds capacity, evicts the oldest entry (the one inserted earliest).
  • Retrieval: Accesses the value for a given key in constant time.
  • Eviction Policy: FIFO – oldest inserted entry is removed when capacity is exceeded.

Space Complexity: O(n), where n is the specified cache capacity.

Sample Usage


FIFOCache<String, Integer> cache = new FIFOCache<>(3);
cache.put("A", 1);
cache.put("B", 2);
cache.put("C", 3);
System.out.println(cache.get("A")); // Output: 1
cache.put("D", 4); // Evicts "A"
System.out.println(cache.contains("A")); // false
System.out.println(cache.size()); // 3
cache.clear();
System.out.println(cache.size()); // 0
